Utterance: Hi again, it's good to see you. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie. I've been okay, I guess. Just trying to keep busy with job applications and stuff.
That’s good to hear you’re staying active. Did you hear back from Ralphs?
Yeah, I did! They actually offered me a part-time position. I start next week.
That’s fantastic! Congratulations! How do you feel about starting this new job?
I’m excited but also a bit nervous. It’s been a while since I worked in a structured environment.
That’s completely understandable. What are you most looking forward to about it?
I think just getting back into a routine. Plus, it'll be nice to have some income coming in again.
Absolutely, having that routine can be really beneficial. How do you think this job might impact your relationship with your girlfriend?
I hope it helps. I think being employed will ease some of the tension. I’ve been feeling a bit like a burden lately.
It’s great that you’re aware of that. Have you discussed these feelings with her?
Not really. I don’t want her to worry more. I just try to put on a brave face.
I can see why you’d feel that way, but sharing your feelings might actually strengthen your relationship. How do you think she would respond?
I think she’d be understanding. She’s supportive, but I just don’t want to add to her stress.
That's a valid concern. It might help to express that you’re working on things and that you appreciate her support.
Yeah, that makes sense. I’ll think about it.
Great. Have you had any moments of anxiety or frustration since we last talked?
A bit, yeah. Mostly when I think about my past and how it affects my job search.
Can you tell me more about that?
Well, I still have that nagging doubt that employers will judge me for my history. It feels like a shadow that follows me.
That sounds really tough. It’s understandable to feel that way, especially when you’re trying to start fresh.
Yeah, I just wish I could shake it off.
Have you tried any strategies to cope with those feelings?
Sometimes I just distract myself with painting or cooking. It helps, but it’s not always enough.
Those are great outlets. Would you be open to trying mindfulness techniques to help you stay grounded in those moments?
Sure, I’m willing to try that.
One technique is to focus on your breathing. When you feel overwhelmed, take a moment to breathe deeply, in through your nose and out through your mouth.
I can do that. I’ve heard about mindfulness before but never really practiced it.
It’s all about being present and acknowledging your thoughts without judgment. You might find it helpful.
I’ll give it a shot.
Good. Let’s check in on your sleep. Has it improved at all since we last spoke?
A little, I guess. I’m still waking up a lot, but I’m managing to fall asleep faster.
That’s progress! Have you been using any techniques to help with that?
I’ve been trying to limit screen time before bed. It seems to help a bit.
That’s a great strategy. Have you noticed any specific thoughts that keep you awake at night?
Yeah, I often start thinking about my past mistakes and what could have been different.
It’s common to ruminate on those thoughts. Would you like to explore ways to challenge those thoughts?
Sure, I’d like that.
One approach is to ask yourself if those thoughts are based on facts or feelings. Can you identify any cognitive distortions?
I think I do that “all-or-nothing” thing a lot. Like, I feel like I’m either completely successful or a total failure.
That’s a significant realization. It’s important to recognize that life is often more nuanced than that.
Yeah, I need to remind myself that it’s okay to have setbacks.
Exactly! Every step you take, even if it feels small, is still progress.
I like that.
Let’s set a goal for the next week. How about practicing mindfulness for a few minutes each day?
I can do that.
Wonderful! And perhaps you can also try to share your feelings with your girlfriend about your job search and how you feel.
That sounds doable. I’ll try to talk to her this weekend.
Great! I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes.
Me too. Thanks for the support, Ellie.
Of course! I’m here for you. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that’s about it for now.
Alright, thank you for sharing today. I’m proud of the steps you’re taking.
Thanks, I appreciate it.
See you next time!
Bye!
